description: Creates a pricing rule can be associated to a pricing plan, or a set of pricing plans.

parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: The token that's needed to support idempotency. Idempotency isn't currently supported, but will be implemented in a future update. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: The pricing rule name. The names must be unique to each pricing rule.

parameters.name: Scope
parameters.description: The scope of pricing rule that indicates if it's globally applicable, or it's service-specific.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: A map that contains tag keys and tag values that are attached to a pricing rule. (string) --- (string) ---

parameters.name: Tiering
parameters.description: The set of tiering configurations for the pricing rule. The possible Amazon Web Services Free Tier configurations. Activate or deactivate Amazon Web Services Free Tier.

nested_params.name: FreeTier
nested_params.description: The possible Amazon Web Services Free Tier configurations.

nested_params.name: Activated
nested_params.description: Activate or deactivate Amazon Web Services Free Tier.

parameters.name: UsageType
parameters.description: Usage type is the unit that each service uses to measure the usage of a specific type of resource. If the Scope attribute is set to SKU, this attribute indicates which usage type the PricingRule is modifying. For example, USW2-BoxUsage:m2.2xlarge describes an `` M2 High Memory Double Extra Large`` instance in the US West (Oregon) Region.

parameters.name: Operation
parameters.description: Operation is the specific Amazon Web Services action covered by this line item. This describes the specific usage of the line item. If the Scope attribute is set to SKU, this attribute indicates which operation the PricingRule is modifying. For example, a value of RunInstances:0202 indicates the operation of running an Amazon EC2 instance.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the created pricing rule.
